intro: Geonoma interrupta subsp. ramosissima, commonly known as the branched geonoma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyclanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, clustered inflorescences and small, white to pale green flowers. Its leaves are typically elongated and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
